poem:
**Beth**

In the flicker of screens,  
a longing carved deep—  
the childless womb,  
a binary beat of hope  
and despair.  
Joe and Molly, fingers entwined,  
seek life amidst pixels,  
a digital vigil—  
silent prayers on whispered wires.  
Time is a tightrope,  
IVF their cross;  
love, a fragile flame,  
lightning the dark.
